comment: He does not care about your grade at all. Please do not take this class if you want an A. He goes into a lot of detail for things that are not in the book. He makes the class WAY harder than what it is supposed to be by teaching it like it is some type of Anatomy and Physiology class. The final was extremely hard!!!! DO NOT TAKE HIM!

This professor is very inconsiderate of his students. he does not care trust me. he says attendance is not mandatory, but gives pop quizzes every other class. Even during the covid-19 pandemic he still was not considerate of his students. only positive thing I can say is that he has nice humor and lectures are ok. my opinion from experience

Took prescription w/ him online. Very unprofessional with mistakes on quizzes and tests & incorrect grammar. Unclear grading criteria for some assignments. I respectfully disagree with the way his class is set up. I get it's online but his tests are EXTREMELY wrong for no reason and the answer choices are absurd. Like busy work? then take him!

I had him for a lecture and an online class and both of them sucked. He gives you the bare minimum on his PPTs, and when it comes time for his quizzes and tests, you wont be prepared enough. He loves trick questions too so be ready for that. His quizzes and tests are way too advanced for the minimal amount of knowledge youll get from his PPTs.

I took him for senior seminar and I am not a fan of how he "teaches". He doesn't prepare you for the quizzes and final at all. The quizzes are difficult and you are given 30 mins for 20 questions. He didn't even take the time to make sure things were correct on the syllabus when it came to assignments, which really rubbed me the wrong way.

I am a 4.0 student and had to get through this class by cheating. You will never be prepared for an exam because he dumbs down the lectures so much. I have no idea how he has such a high rating but definitely avoid because very few people made an A in this class. If you are forced to take him, make some friends and work together on the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great humor, awesome lectures! Make sure you skim/read the chapter before heading to classthe course itself is very tedious! Can be tough on grading, but he explains things very well and accurately in class. The guy is my favorite professor.

Assignments and exams are online. The exams are hard, the book will be your best friend. His lectures do not prepare you for the exams at all. You get 0's for late work. He will not bump you either (I had a 79.4) and this was in part due to late work that I couldn't get any credit for. He's funny and dumbs down lectures so they don't prepare you.

He is a very interesting guy and makes learning the material fun. All of his quizzes and tests are online, with 75 minutes to complete 100 questions as the format for the exams and 10 question weekly quizzes for each chapter. Attendance is not mandatory, but you will want to be there for the Kahoot review days.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: His lectures are VERY interesting but no help in preparing for the exams. His online exams are pretty difficult, you have 75 minutes to answer 100 questions which is very stressful. Read the book and look at his powerpoints. Gives random kahoot quizzes for participation
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Tests are open note/open book, but gives you 75 minutes for 100 questions which can be stressful if the questions are long. Everything is online and he gives you outlines of his powerpoints. You do need to work hard in this class, it's not an easy A but it's not extremely difficult to do well.

Had him for Senior seminar. Usually only one teacher per semester teaches it. Better hope it isn't him!  Not very clear in what he wants you to know or assignment details. There is a pre-test on the first day of class that is part of your final grade. Theres no point in going to lectures and it isn't required!

ES 4900. Very unpleasant. PowerPoints are blank and he never goes over them. Stormed out of class after being frustrated with us for not answering a question he proposed quickly enough. Told aspiring Therapists that they would never get in to grad school. Grades everything in the final 2 weeks of semester. Final grade on last day before deadline.

He is a great professor just wished he would give study guides for his test. 3 test, a few online quizzes, twitter assignment and a final. For the twitter assignments you need 100 tweets by mid Nov don't wait until the last minute! Test are kind of hard because he questions are worded tricky. Final was very easy just questions from previous test.
Tests are quite difficult and professor has a strong Russian accent which makes him very difficult to understnad.  Very disappointed in my low grade.

Posts powerpoints. Quizzes online. Exams are online in class. Twitter assignment that is easy but takes lots of time. I did not even buy the book. I took the class in the summer and he gives you a break every hour.

Amazing and Intelligent Professor. He can be hard to understand, but is willing to do everything he can to help you with the material. VERY APPROACHABLE! He truly cares about his students, and wants you to succeed not only in his class, but also in your future career. I would take him again for any course!

This class was pretty easy. You have a semester long Twitter project so don't wait to finish it. You'll also have a semester long group project but it's super easy, my group finished in 1 week. You will have online quizzes to complete.  He's a pretty cool guy overall. I never used the textbook. He posts PowerPoints online. Study for the tests.

-Amazing! Super great at giving feedback and meeting your student needs. -Exams are a little scattered but review the notes, and read the book. You'll be fine. -Participate and ask questions during discussions, about the quizzes, and projects, it's all for your grade. -He's willing to work one on one when needed. -HE ROCKS ! :D

Excellent professor teaching a dumbed down course. Fun to listen to in lecture though I feel this class would be much better off taken during a 4 week summer semester. 16 weeks its too long for the small amount of material that is covered in this course. But Dr Feito himself is great and there's pretty much no take home work
Great Professor

Excellent teacher who provides help for his students in the classroom and as an advisor. Prepares you mentally for the future and gives you advice to help you succeed in life. Knows how to educate properly and helps everyone understand the material always! Overall an amazing teacher and very helpful advisor!

Great proffesor, really knows his stuff, spends time outside the office helping students anytime hes free. Will do what he can to help you get the material. Only issue is, hes little late on posting grades, but its probabably cause he does a lot. overall excellent professor one of the best for exercise science
Overall Great Teacher. Best lectures were when he included students going up to board and asking them numerous questions throughout powerpoints. I think he should do that more often.
EXCELLENT
One of the best prefessors I have ever had in my life. He loves what he teaches.
Awesome professor!!! Very helpful and friendly, which helps to understand the material! Very easy going!!!

One of the best professors, gets students involved, and thinking critically.  Material well understood and presesnted well, such a loss to Barry to lose him.  Best professor in SES department, extremely knowledgeable and helpful, going to be missed for sure!

Great Professor! Treats students with respect, genuinely shows interest in students, and always has time to help. All his exams are case studies of what you'll see in a real clinical setting, thus prepares you for your internship.
Great professor! He's all about helping you do your best in his class and in the Exercise Science program.
great teacher
